message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

This paper deals with the problem of implementing a specific skill in an artificial player (bot) in a real-time strategy game. This involves finding an appropriate building placement to block the entrance to the player's base. The solution presented uses answer set programming (ASP), which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (AI) and logic programming (PL). The paper also discusses the importance of experimentation and encourages readers to try different declarative approaches, which aligns with the subfield of machine learning (LG) and game theory (GT). Finally, the paper addresses the problem of implementation in imperative languages like C++ or Java, which falls under the subfield of software engineering (SE).
